H199.def: = marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded

H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H238.def: = to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H2441.def: = upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H3476.def: = state in which humans are morally and ethically right

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H4448.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ◄ as if in mourning, ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H1305.def: = action by which someone carefully examines a group of objects in order to determine whether they meet certain criteria

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H5397.def: = the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H3320.def: = action by which humans or deities take position in a certain place for a specific purpose

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H7169.def: = causative action by which humans press their lips together, ≈ which is associated with evil intent

H2563.def: = stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

H367.def: = state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death

H1204.def: = causative process by which a creature or object causes someone else to be in deep distress

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2134.def: = state in which a substance has not been mixed or adulterated with any other substance

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2643.def: = state in which humans are clean in the sense of not being stained by morally and/or ethically unacceptable behavior

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H8569.def: = causative action by which humans or deities use their influence or authority to keep something from happening

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5465.def: = a wooden structure with holes for securing a person’s feet and hands, in which criminals are locked

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H4069.def: = a reference to the cause, reason or purpose of an event; normally used in  questions with the purpose of identifying that cause, reason, or purpose; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that these things cannot be identified

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H7789.def: = action by which humans move from one place to another

H2472.def: = process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment

H2384.def: = process by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H8639.def: = state in which humans are deeply asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with having dreams and visions, sometimes with being inactive

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H8572.def: = state in which humans are sleeping relatively lightly; ≈ sometimes associated with being inactive

H4904.def: = state in which humans are lying down to rest

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H2856.def: = to put a seal on a written document; ► in order to confirm that the document is authentic and to keep unauthorized readers from having access to it; ≈ associated with both authenticity and secrecy

H4561.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

4.gl: to uncover (someone's) ear(s) > to open (someone's) ear(s)

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H1466.def: = state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7973.def: = tool designed to inflict bodily harm, used in armed conflicts

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H4904.def: = state in which humans are lying down to rest

H4341.def: = state in which humans are physically wounded

H386.def: = state of not being subject to change

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H2092.def: = process by which someone reacts with a strong distaste to the present of some substance

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H8378.def: = process by which someone senses a physical craving for food

H3978.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H7210.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H5290.def: = the period of a person's life ranging from early childhood to adulthood

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5934.def: = state in which humans are still relatively young; ≈ associated with strength but also with reckless living

H6279.def: = action by which humans ask a deity earnestly to do something

H7521.def: = state in which an animal or its meat is acceptable to God as sacrifice

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H8643.def: = loud sound ◄ produced either by the human voice or by musical instruments ► used to express an emotion or to communicate something to a community

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
